definition: the act of raising something, perform cosmetic surgery on someone's face
details:
noun
- the act of raising something
= example: the act of raising something
= synonyms: heave
- a ride in a car
= example: a ride in a car
- transportation of people or goods by air (especially when other means of access are unavailable)
= synonyms: airlift
- plastic surgery to remove wrinkles and other signs of aging from your face
= synonyms: nip and tuck, face lift, facelift, face lifting, cosmetic surgery, rhytidectomy, rhytidoplasty
- the act of giving temporary assistance
- lifting device consisting of a platform or cage that is raised and lowered mechanically in a vertical shaft in order to move people from one floor to another in a building
= synonyms: elevator
- one of the layers forming the heel of a shoe or boot
- a device worn in a shoe or boot to make the wearer look taller or to correct a shortened leg
- a powered conveyance that carries skiers up a hill
= synonyms: ski tow, ski lift
- a wave that lifts the surface of the water or ground
= synonyms: rise
- the event of something being raised upward
= synonyms: raising, elevation
- the component of the aerodynamic forces acting on an airfoil that opposes gravity
= synonyms: aerodynamic lift
verb
- perform cosmetic surgery on someone's face
= synonyms: face-lift
- remove from a surface
= example: remove from a surface
- take off or away by decreasing
= example: take off or away by decreasing
- remove from a seedbed or from a nursery
= example: remove from a seedbed or from a nursery
- remove (hair) by scalping
- put an end to
= example: put an end to
= synonyms: raise, end, snuff out, extinguish
- rise upward, as from pressure or moisture
= example: rise upward, as from pressure or moisture
- raise in rank or condition
= example: raise in rank or condition
= synonyms: raise
- invigorate or heighten
= example: invigorate or heighten
= synonyms: raise
- call to stop the hunt or to retire, as of hunting dogs
- cancel officially
= synonyms: overturn
- make audible
= example: make audible
- take root crops out of the ground
= example: take root crops out of the ground
- fly people or goods to or from places not accessible by other means
= example: fly people or goods to or from places not accessible by other means
= synonyms: airlift
- raise or haul up with or as if with mechanical help
= synonyms: wind, hoist
- take hold of something and move it to a different location
= example: take hold of something and move it to a different location
- move upward
= example: move upward
= synonyms: rise, arise, uprise, go up, come up, move up
- move upwards
= example: move upwards
= synonyms: raise
- raise from a lower to a higher position
= synonyms: raise, get up, bring up, elevate
- make off with belongings of others
= synonyms: pinch
- take illegally
= synonyms: rustle, loot, plunder
- take without referencing from someone else's writing or speech
= synonyms: plagiarise, plagiarize
- pay off (a mortgage)
- rise up
= synonyms: rise, rear
